title: Bitcoin whales not selling despite $70K — BTC holdings growth ‘is going parabolic’
description:
Bitcoin addresses holding at least 1,000 BTC is climbing again despite BTC price reaching over $70,000 for the first time.

Bitcoin (BTC) whales are not in a rush to sell into the current rally that propelled Bitcoin to new heights above $70,000, the latest on-chain data suggests. 

The number of unique addresses holding at least 1,000 Bitcoin, or so-called “whales," has risen to 2,104 addresses as of March 7.

However, this is still lower than the record of 2,489 addresses reached in February 2021, when Bitcoin was trading above $46,000.

Read more

title: Op-ed: Interoperability needs its ERC-20 moment
description:
Undoubtedly, one of the prerequisites for the mass adoption of blockchain technology is secure and seamless cross-chain interoperability. Many potential applications, particularly in complex and regulated sectors, simply can not be deployed without common guidelines and interface definitions. Without these, as is currently the case, applications that aim to go cross-chain must rely on custom […]

title: Chinese Researchers Combine Physics and AI to Revolutionize Precipitation Forecasting
description: Chinese researchers have achieved a significant breakthrough in weather prediction by integrating physics and artificial intelligence (AI). Led by the Institute of Atmospheric Physics (IAP) of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the study, published in the prestigious journal Geophysical Research Letters, unveils a novel approach to enhancing precipitation forecasts. title: Worldcoin initiates legal action against Spanish government over crypto ban
description: In a bold move, Worldcoin (WLD), the privacy-focused crypto project, has announced its decision to pursue legal action against the Spanish government following its ban in the European nation. The conflict arose after the Spanish Data Collection Agency (AEPD) ordered Worldcoin to cease its data collection practices, citing concerns over infringement of user privacy. Compliance […]

title: Archiving Revolutionizes Access to Nigerian History with Cloud-Based Archiving
description: In a groundbreaking initiative, Fu’ad Lawal, Chief Archivist at Archiving, is spearheading efforts to digitize Nigeria’s historical newspapers and make them readily accessible to the public through cloud technology. This ambitious endeavor aims to provide researchers, journalists, and the general public with a comprehensive digital archive spanning Nigeria’s political, social, and cultural history since its […]

title: Bitcoin Could Skyrocket Over 110% Amid a More Favorable Backdrop, Says Fundstrat’s Tom Lee – Here’s the Timeline
description:
The founder and head of research at Fundstrat Global Advisors Tom Lee is doubling down on a prediction that Bitcoin (BTC) could hit six figures. Lee says in a new CNBC interview that Bitcoin could appreciate by around 119% within a period of less than two years. According to the Fundstrat executive, a number of […]
